ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying in the Bhagga country at Susumāragira in the Bhesakaḷā Grove, the deer park.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.2_0: the monks in the Kokanada stilt house were receiving the drinking-water vessel with hands soiled with food.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.3_0: People complained and criticized the monks,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.4_0: “How can the Sakyan ascetics receive drinking-water vessel with hands? They are just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.5_0: The monks heard the complaints of those people
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.6_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.8_0: “Is it true, monks, that they do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.11_0: “... How can those foolish men do this?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.12_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.13_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.14.1_0: ‘“I will not receive the drinking-water vessel with a hand soiled with food,” this is how you should train.’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.15_0: One should not receive the drinking-water vessel with a hand soiled with food.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.16_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, receives drinking water with a hand soiled with food, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.17.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.19_0: To give rise to the robe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.22_0: if he receives it with the intention of washing it or having it washed;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.25_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.26_0: The fifth training rule is finished.
